greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Carryless product 11 X n base 10.
comment: a(n) <= 11*n; a(m) = 11*m iff m is a term of A039691. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 05 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
David Applegate, Marc LeBrun and N. J. A. Sloane, Carryless Arithmetic (I): The Mod 10 Version.
example: a(19)=109 since we have 11 X 19 = carryless sum of 100, 90, 10 and 9 =109
program: where ds = map (read . return) $ show n
xref: Cf. A001477 for carryless 1 X n, A004520 for carryless 2 X 10 base 10, A055120 for carryless 9 X n, A008592 for carryless 10 X n.
Cf. A048724 carryless 3Xn in base 2, A242399 carryless 4Xn in base 3.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Feb 19 2001
